attributes.action: ensure that NHS trusts and Primary Care Trusts in the UK provide funding for Bone Anchored Hearing Aids (BAHA) to those deaf people who need them.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently BAHAs are not available to all Deaf people who need them. When an NHS consultant says that a BAHA is your only hope of hearing normally again,it should be provided by the NHS system.  

The NHS was set up to provide health care to those who need it 'at the point of access'. Primary Care Trusts should not have the right to deny people the right to hear.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "ensure that NHS trusts and Primary Care Trusts in the UK provide funding for Bone Anchored Hearing Aids (BAHA) to those deaf people who need them."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page21498


Prime Minister's Office
